methods.name: .map
methods.description: creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.

methods.name: .filter
methods.description: creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.
methods.example: let words = ['spray', 'limit' 'elite', 'exuberant', 'destruction' 'present'] const result = words.filter(word => word.length > 6) console.log(result) // expected output: Array ['exuberant', 'destruction', 'present']

methods.name: .reduce
methods.description: executes a reducer function (that you provide) on each member of the array resulting in a single output value.
